edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment3

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment3.Card
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BangCard, MinusCard, PercentCard, PlusCard, PoundCard, QuestionCard, SlashCard, StarCard

    public abstract class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the abstract notion of a Card, which contatins the attributes of every type of card included in the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card(java.lang.String symbol)
      This is the default constructor for the class, which requires that every subclass of Card must have a symbol associated with it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flip()
      This method simulates the real-life idea of flipping a card face-up by setting flipped to true.
      java.lang.String getSymbol()
      This method simply returns the value of symbol for purposes of displaying it along the rows and columns of a Grid.
      boolean isFlipped()
      This method simulates the real-life idea of determining whether a card is flipped or not by observing the state of flipped.
      void unflip()
      This method simulates the real-life idea of flipping a card face-down by setting flipped to false.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(java.lang.String symbol)
        This is the default constructor for the class, which requires that every subclass of Card must have a symbol associated with it.
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol that will be assigned to symbol.

    • Method Detail

      • flip

        public void flip()
        This method simulates the real-life idea of flipping a card face-up by setting flipped to true.

      • isFlipped

        public boolean isFlipped()
        This method simulates the real-life idea of determining whether a card is flipped or not by observing the state of flipped.
        Returns:
        The value of flipped.

      • unflip

        public void unflip()
        This method simulates the real-life idea of flipping a card face-down by setting flipped to false.

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.String getSymbol()
        This method simply returns the value of symbol for purposes of displaying it along the rows and columns of a Grid.
        Returns:
        The symbolic representation of a Card a.k.a type.
